title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: But dismal or not dismal, the night had apparently no evil effecton the spirits of the one man who was trudging his homeward way fromCrailing to Eckford.

title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: The road fromCrailing was in places dour with mud, heavy-rutted by harvest carts,with ever and anon a great puddle that stretched across from ditch toditch.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: His common language was,—" that not an individual in the town would bejudged at the last day,—Jedburgh would be at oncedamned by the slump .'" He again resolved to commence the profession of agriculture, and took thefarm of Habton, in the neighbouring parish of Crailing.
